text: あれ?シンちゃんおだし変わった?
translation: Huh? Shin-chan, did your soup stock change?
grammar: The sentence ends with a rising intonation question marker, typical of casual speech.

text: ああ、それもしんちゃんの生き方なんだから。 / 彼の生き方を容認するなんて甘い!
translation: Well, that's just Shin-chan's way of living. / Accepting his lifestyle is too lenient!
grammar: なんて after a verb phrase expresses criticism or disapproval ('doing X is...').

text: 最近みさと、しんじに甘すぎるんじゃない? / そう? / カジさんとよりが戻ったからって、他人に幸せを押し付けないでよね。
translation: Lately, Misato, aren't you being too soft on Shinji? / Really? / Just because you got back together with Kaji, don't push your happiness on others.

vocabulary.meaning: to force upon / to push onto

grammar: からって is a casual form of からといって, meaning 'just because...' with an implication of criticism.

text: カジのことはなんでもないわよ。
translation: There's nothing going on with Kaji.
grammar: Xのこと refers to 'the matter of X' or 'things concerning X'.

text: よぉ、かつわき。 / 酒のう / まい店見つけたんだ。こんばんど。じゃ。
translation: Hey, Katsuragi. / I found a place with good sake. Tonight then. See ya.
grammar: じゃ is a casual farewell, short for じゃあね (see you).

text: どれどれ?
translation: Let me see...

vocabulary.meaning: let me see / let's have a look

grammar: Reduplication of どれ creates an expression used when examining or checking something.

text: おお、これが自信に繋がればいいんだけどね / 聞こえる?しんじくん
translation: Oh, it would be good if this leads to confidence... / Can you hear me, Shinji-kun?
grammar: ばいいんだけど expresses a hopeful wish ('it would be nice if...').

text: みさとさん、今のテストの毛葛藤でした
translation: Misato-san, the test results just now were [excellent].
grammar: The formal past tense でした is used for polite reporting.

text: まいっちゃったわよね、あっさり抜かれちゃったじゃない? / ここまで簡単にやられると正直ちょっと悔しいわよね
translation: We're in trouble, aren't we? We got overtaken so easily. / When beaten this easily, honestly it's a bit frustrating.

vocabulary.meaning: to be defeated / to give up

grammar: ちゃう/ちゃった is casual contraction of てしまう, indicating completion or regret.

text: すごい、素晴らしい、強い、強すぎる! / 無敵のシンジ様!
translation: Amazing, wonderful, strong, too strong! / The invincible Shinji-sama!
grammar: すぎる attached to adjective stems means 'too much' or 'excessively'.

text: これであたしたちも楽できるってもんじゃないの! / ねえ!
translation: With this, we can take it easy too, right! / Right!
grammar: ってもんじゃない is casual speech pattern meaning 'isn't it the case that...' seeking agreement.

text: まあね、あたしたちもせいぜい置いてけぼり食わないように頑張らなきゃ! / さよなら。
translation: Well yeah, we'd better do our best not to get left behind! / Goodbye.

vocabulary.meaning: at best / as much as possible

grammar: なきゃ is casual contraction of なければならない (must do).

text: 次は、清少可能瀬。次は清少可能瀬。
translation: Next stop is [station name]. Next stop is [station name].
grammar: Train announcement pattern: 次は + station name.

text: 古本中古ソフトのお店 マシャール前
translation: Used books and secondhand software shop, in front of Marshall.
grammar: Noun + 前 indicates 'in front of' a location.

text: よし
translation: Alright! / Good!
grammar: Exclamation used to express determination or readiness.

text: 西区の住民避難あと5分かかります / 目標は未足進行中、前進2.5km / 遅いわよ / ごめん!どうなってんの?フジの電波観測場は?
translation: Evacuation of Nishi-ku residents will take 5 more minutes. / Target is advancing, 2.5km forward. / Too slow! / Sorry! What's going on? What about Fuji's radio observation station?
grammar: あと + time + かかる means 'it will take X more time'.

text: 探知してません!直上にいきなり現れました / パターンオレンジ、AT / フィールド反応なし! / どういうこと?新種の嫉妬
translation: Not detected! It appeared suddenly directly above! / Pattern orange, no AT Field reaction! / What does this mean? A new type of Angel?
grammar: いきなり is an adverb meaning 'suddenly' or 'without warning'.

text: マギは判断を保留しています
translation: MAGI is withholding judgment.
grammar: を保留している means 'is withholding/suspending (something)'.

text: こんな / 時に怒り司令はいないのよね / お
translation: At a time like this, Commander Ikari isn't here...
grammar: のよね is a feminine sentence ending seeking confirmation or expressing mild frustration.

text: 疲
translation: [Sound/Music]
grammar: Appears to be a partial transcription or sound effect.

text: そりゃもう、こういうのは成績優秀、有門果敢、シンクロ率ナンバーワンの殿方の仕事でしょ?
translation: Well of course, this kind of thing is the job for someone with excellent grades, brave and daring, the gentleman with the number one sync rate, right?
grammar: でしょ? is a casual question tag seeking agreement, similar to 'right?' or 'isn't it?'

text: それともシンちゃん、自信ないのかな? / 行けるよ!お手本見せて / やるよ、アスカ。 / なんでって? / ちょっとあなたたち? / 言ったでしょ、ミサトさん。
translation: Or maybe, Shin-chan, you don't have confidence? / I can do it! Show them an example! / I'll do it, Asuka. / Why, you ask? / Hey, you two? / I told you, Misato-san.
grammar: のかな is a softer, wondering way to ask a question, expressing uncertainty.

text: You areナンバーワンって。 / いや、あれは… / 戦いは男の仕事! / 全時代的! / いい!2号機バックアップ! / 0号機もバックアップに回ります
translation: You are number one, she said. / No, that was... / Fighting is a man's job! / How old-fashioned! / Fine! Unit-02, backup! / Unit-00 will also move to backup.

vocabulary.meaning: to turn / to move to (a position)

grammar: に回る means 'to move to (a role/position)' - here, moving to backup position.

text: あの子たち勝手に / シンジ君ずいぶん立派になったじゃない? / だめよ / 帰ったら叱っておかなきゃ
translation: Those kids, acting on their own... / Shinji-kun has really grown up, hasn't he? / No good. / When he gets back, I'll have to scold him.
grammar: ておかなきゃ = ておかなければならない, meaning 'must do (in advance/preparation)'.

text: あなたいいホボさんになれるわよ
translation: You could become a good mother, you know.
grammar: わよ is a feminine sentence ending that adds emphasis and assertion.
